name: Andhra Chicken Curry
history: Andhra Chicken Curry is a traditional dish from the Andhra Pradesh region in South India. Renowned for its fiery spiciness and rich flavor, it embodies the culinary essence of the region.
description: Andhra Chicken Curry, also known as Kodi Kura, is a spicy and flavorful curry made with chicken, a variety of spices, and a rich gravy base. It often includes poppy seeds and coconut, adding depth to its taste.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add curry leaves, onions, and ginger-garlic paste. SautÃ© until onions are golden. Add green chilies, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and red chili powder.

instructions.title: Cook the Chicken
instructions.description: Add chicken pieces to the pan. Cook until the chicken is lightly browned.

instructions.title: Add Coconut and Poppy Seeds
instructions.description: Mix in the ground poppy seeds and grated coconut. Cook for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Simmer with Tomatoes
instructions.description: Add chopped tomatoes and salt. Cover and cook until the tomatoes are soft and the chicken is tender.

instructions.title: Finish with Garam Masala
instructions.description: Stir in garam masala and simmer for a few more minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or Indian bread like roti or naan.

tips: Adjust the amount of red chili powder according to your spice tolerance.
Poppy seeds and coconut add a unique flavor and texture to the curry.
variations: Add a splash of tamarind juice for a tangy twist.
Incorporate other vegetables like bell peppers or potatoes for added nutrition.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish, garnished with a lemon wedge.
Pair with a cool cucumber raita for a refreshing contrast.
